sources.data_found: The Cloud service hardware consists of 5 Intel nodes and 4 DGX-A100 nodes.
This UAB addition incorporates four DGX A100 systems with 2nd Gen AMD EPYC processors. Each DGX system can allocate up to 56 GPU instances using NVIDIA multi-instance GPU (MIG) technology.

The supercomputer — High Performance Computing Cluster at 110 Tflops, powered by Dell EMC — consists of a mix of Dell EMC PowerEdge 13th Generation Servers, all with Intel 24-core Haswell processors, 36x128GB RAM nodes, 38x256GB RAM nodes, 14x384GB RAM, four nodes with nVidia K80 GPU cards, and four nodes with Intel Xeon Phi cards.
Gen7: 18 2x14 core (504 cores total) 2.4GHz Intel Xeon E5-2680 v4 compute nodes with 256GB RAM, four NVIDIA Tesla P100 16GB GPUs, and EDR InfiniBand interconnect (supported by UAB, 2017).
For the academic year 2023-2024, total of 21,160 students have enrolled in University of Alabama at Birmingham with 12,382 undergraduate and 8,778 graduate students.

In 2023, the most popular Masters Degree concentrations at University of Alabama at Birmingham were Registered Nursing (588 degrees awarded), General Business Administration & Management (384 degrees), and General Public Health (248 degrees).

student_data.notes: UAB CS department does not publish specific enrollment numbers by major. Total UAB enrollment is 21,160 (12,382 undergrad, 8,778 grad). Based on CS being part of College of Arts & Sciences and typical CS program sizes at similar R1 universities, estimates: Undergrad CS ~850 (estimated 6.8% of undergrads), MS CS ~280 (estimated from graduate programs), PhD CS ~45 (estimated based on 4-year PhD program duration with typical admissions).

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: 4 nodes with NVIDIA K80 GPU cards (2017 Cheaha expansion). Each K80 has dual GPUs.

gpu_resources.notes: UAB Cheaha cluster GPU resources: 1) Cloud service: 4 DGX-A100 nodes × 8 A100 GPUs/node = 32 A100 (80GB assumed for DGX-A100). 2) Gen7 nodes (2017): 18 nodes with 4 P100 16GB GPUs each = 72 P100. 3) 2017 expansion: 4 nodes with NVIDIA K80 GPUs. Total confirmed: 32 A100 + 72 P100 = 104 GPUs. The '80 accelerators' mentioned in obsolete docs likely includes Intel Xeon Phi cards.

analysis_notes: UAB operates the Cheaha supercomputer, Alabama's fastest HPC cluster. GPU infrastructure includes modern A100 GPUs in DGX systems for AI/ML workloads and older P100 GPUs for general compute. CS enrollment estimated from university-wide data as department-specific numbers not published.
